text: Aleksandar Srdić (; born 30 May 1992) is a Serbian football winger who plays for Swish club FC Freienbach. ==Career== Born in Trebišov, Czechoslovakia (now Slovakia), he played in Serbian lower-league sides Radnički Beograd, BASK and PKB Padinska SkelaAleksandar Srdic at Srbijafudbal, retrieved 28-4-2015 before moving to Slovenian side Celje during the winter break of the 2012–13 season. He played with Celje in the Slovenian First League until the following winter-break of the 2013–14 seasonAleksander Srdič at prvaliga.si when he moved to Greece and played the rest of the season with Serres in the Greek Football League (second league). In summer 2014 he moved to Romania and joined Săgeata Năvodari playing in the Liga II. During the winter break of the 2014–15 season he returned to Serbia and joined Mačva Šabac paying in Serbian second-tier. Ahead of the 2019–20 season, Srdić joined Swiss club FC Freienbach from FC Regensdorf.Debüt für drei Neue beim FC Freienbach, regional-fussball.ch, 3 July 2019 ==Honours== ;BASK * Serbian First League: 2010–11 ==References== ==External links== * * Category:1992 births Category:Living people Category:People from Trebišov Category:Association football wingers Category:Serbian footballers Category:FK Radnički Beograd players Category:FK BASK players Category:FK Mačva Šabac players Category:Serbian expatriate footballers Category:Serbian expatriate sportspeople in Slovenia Category:Expatriate footballers in Slovenia Category:Slovenian PrvaLiga players Category:NK Celje players Category:NK Aluminij players Category:Serbian expatriate sportspeople in Greece Category:Expatriate footballers in Greece Category:Serbian expatriate sportspeople in Romania Category:Expatriate footballers in Romania Category:Serbian expatriate sportspeople in Switzerland Category:Expatriate footballers in Switzerland Category:AFC Săgeata Năvodari players
title: Aleksandar Srdić
